Imports

strutils, hts_concat, hts_concat, strutils

Types

Header = ref object of RootObj
  hdr*: ptr bam_hdr_t
Header wraps the bam header info.   Source Edit 
Record = ref object of RootObj
  b: ptr bam1_t
  hdr: Header
Record is a single alignment object.   Source Edit 
Bam = ref object of RootObj
  hts: ptr hts_file
  hdr*: Header
  rec: Record
  idx: ptr hts_idx_t
Bam wraps a BAM/CRAM/SAM reader object from htslib.   Source Edit 
Target = ref object of RootObj
  name*: string
  length*: uint32
  tid*: int
Target is a chromosome or contig from the bam header.   Source Edit 
Flag = distinct uint16
  Source Edit 
Cigar = ref object of RootObj
  cig: SafeCPtr[uint32]
  n: uint32
Cigar represents ths SAM Cigar type. It consists of one or more Op.   Source Edit 
Op = distinct uint32
Op holds the operation (length and type) of each element of a Cigar.   Source Edit

proc open_hts(path: cstring; threads: cint = 2; fai: cstring = nil; index: bool = false): Bam {.

    raises: [ValueError], tags: []
.}
open_hts returns a bam object for the given path. If CRAM, then fai must be given. if index is true, then it will attempt to open an index file for regional queries.   Source Edit

iterator query(bam: Bam; chrom: string; start: int; stop: int): Record {.

    raises: [ValueError], tags: []
.}
query iterates over the given region. A single element is used and overwritten on each iteration so use Record.copy to retain.   Source Edit 
iterator items(bam: Bam): Record {.
raises: [], tags: []
.}
items iterates over a bam. A single element is used and overwritten on each iteration so use Record.copy to retain.   Source Edit
